title: Design flaw using downloaders in ORA special remote?

labels.name: RIA/ORA
labels.description: Issues related to RIA-based workflows and related components

body:
I have a dataset with a configured ORA remoted that points to a password-protected HTTP server.

```
% git annex get Simulation2GenerateRun.m
get Simulation2GenerateRun.m (from inm7-storage...) 
[INFO] Downloading 'https://archive.ds.inm7.de/c27/71672-96c4-11ea-be6a-a0369f287950/annex/objects/GX/88/MD5E-s1749--847057de59b55cf34e98757525ba7809.m/MD5E-s1749--847057de59b55cf34e98757525ba7809.m' into '.git/annex/tmp/MD5E-s1749--847057de59b55cf34e98757525ba7809.m' 
[INFO] http session: Authenticating into session for https://archive.ds.inm7.de/c27/71672-96c4-11ea-be6a-a0369f287950/annex/objects/GX/88/MD5E-s1749--847057de59b55cf34e98757525ba7809.m/MD5E-s1749--847057de59b55cf34e98757525ba7809.m 

  A non-interactive silent UI was asked for a response to a question: user. Title: You need to authenticate with 'ds.inm7.de' credentials..
```

There is no way for me to enter these credentials interactively, because interactivity is not possible at this stage (git-annex talks to the special remote binary).

I have

```
[provider:ds.inm7.de]
url_re = https.*://.*ds\.inm7\.de
authentication_type = http_basic_auth
credential = ds.inm7.de

[credential:ds.inm7.de]
type = user_password
```

but I do not think this matters or is suboptimal. I believe this is a design flaw. The only way out would be to prime the credential store prior to the first `get`. The necessary credentials are known to git (git clone works fine), but #5028 is not implemented. This only leaves #5680
